name: Seda Ogrenci Memik
content: Seda's Web Site Seda Ogrenci-Memik, Professor Department of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science Northwestern University seda@northwesternDOTedu Office: Tech Building, L471. 2145 Sheridan Road, Evanston, IL 60208 Phone: (847) 491-7378 Fax: (847) 467-4144 Research Interests Thermal Management for High Performance Computing Designing on-chip sensing, cooling, harvesting systems using thermoelectric materials Thermal- and Power-Aware 3D Stacked Memory Systems Reconfigurable Architectures and Synthesis Tools Teaching Regularly teaching EECS 303 Advanced Digital Design, EECS 355 FPGA Design, EECS 459 VLSI Algorithmics Class Coordinator for McCormick Murphy Scholars Recent Professional Activities Associate Editor of International Journal of Reconfigurable Computing 2013-present Associate Editor of IEEE TVLSI 2007-2015 Technical Program Co-Chair, Embedded and Ubiquitous Computing 2015 Curriculum Vitae Publications News Heat Management in Integrated Circuits: On-Chip and System-Level Monitoring and Cooling published by IET in 2016 Seda Ogrenci-Memik co-organized the 2016 Workshop on FPGAs for Scientific Simulation and Data Analytics Seda Ogrenci-Memik named Member of Program Committee for 2016 Turkish American Scientists and Scholars Association Conference Ogrenci-Memik & WIC Members Introduce Scratch Programming to High School Students Seda Ogrenci-Memik Featured in 2014 Northwestern Excellence in Research Annual Report Current PhD Student Members of the Ogrenci-Memik Lab Dawei Li (2011) Kaicheng Zhang (2011) (co-Adviser G. Memik) Siddhartha Joshi (2015) Yingyi Luo (2015) Awards and Honors EECS Best Teacher Award 2013 Distinguished Visitor, School of Computer Science, Complutense Universidad de Madrid, March-May 2010 NSF CAREER Award 2006
